summary: a novel lineage C betacoronavirus the MERS coronavirus (MERS-CoV) has been confirmed to be the etiological agent. the subsequent detection of MERS-CoV and its antibodies in various countries in the Middle East has led to the hypothesis that these animals may be the reservoir for MERS-CoV. a monoclonal antibody-based capture ELISA was developed in a cross-sectional epidemiological study of a dromedary dairy herd in Dubai after sudden death. there were no adult male dromedaries in the herd and mating was human-assisted. microplates were pre-coated with the first anti-MERS-CoV-recombinant N protein monoclonal antibody 1F6. the plate was shaken for 2 min and incubated at 37 °C for 30 min. 100 L of the anti-MERS-CoV antibody 7C4 conjugated with horseradish peroxidase was added. detection was carried out by adding 100 L of tetramethylbenzidine per well.
